{"blocks":[{"key":"5lmgn","text":"We use the Top3 quantification method (references below) to calculate the absolute protein abundance as fractions of total protein mass in each sample. Briefly, the Top3 quantification method is based on the “best flyer” hypothesis, which assumes that the specific MS signal intensity of the most intense tryptic peptides per protein is approximately constant throughout a whole proteome (ref: Ludwig et al. Mol. Cell. Proteomics 2012). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"do4h0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5qc0c","text":"Our Top3 quantification analysis consists of:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vba","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1sidv","text":"Filter the DIA-NN peptide report data (from step 1) to only proteins that have three or more peptides identified across all samples","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"plt5","text":"For each protein, rank the top 3 peptides by intensity (counts) in each of the samples","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fiq3k","text":"Calculate the mean rankings of the peptides in each protein across all samples","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eneg2","text":"Filter the data to the three highest ranked peptides in each protein","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eto2m","text":"Calculate protein intensity (counts) by averaging the intensity (counts) of the Top3 peptides","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"37i41","text":"Calculate the percent of the total protein abundance","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"38f4e","text":"        ((intensity of individual protein / sum of all protein intensities in a given sample) *
